Detailed Description

The TaskManager class controls the execution of tasks on a Thread of a ThreadPool.

Author:
Frank Fock
Version:
3.5.19

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

TaskManager::TaskManager (  ThreadPool *  ,
int  stackSize = AGENTPP_DEFAULT_STACKSIZE
) 
 

Create a TaskManager and insert the created thread into the given ThreadPool.

Parameters:
threadPool a pointer to a ThreadPool instance.
stackSize the stack size for the managed thread.

virtual TaskManager::~TaskManager (   )  [virtual]
 

Destructor will wait for thread to terminate.

Member Function Documentation

TaskManager* TaskManager::clone (   )  [inline]
 

Clone this TaskManager.

boolean TaskManager::is_idle (   )  [inline]
 

Check whether this thread is idle or not.

Returns:
TRUE if the thread managed by this TaskManager does not currently execute any task; FALSE otherwise.

void TaskManager::run (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

When an object implementing interface Runnable is used to create a thread, starting the thread causes the object's run method to be called in that separately executing thread.

Implements Runnable.

boolean TaskManager::set_task (  Runnable *   ) 
 

Set the next task for execution.

This will block until current task has finished execution.

Parameters:
task a Runnable instance.
Returns:
TRUE if the task could be assigned successfully and FALSE if another thread has assigned a task concurrently. In the latter case, the task has not been assigned!

void TaskManager::start (   )  [inline]
 

Start thread execution.

void TaskManager::stop (   )  [inline]
 

Stop thread execution after having finished current task.
